ME5E.title: ME5e Game System
ME5E.AbilityUseHint: Configure how you would like to use the {name} {type}.
ME5E.AbilityUseUnavailableHint: There are no uses of this item remaining!
ME5E.AbilityUseChargedHint: This {type} is charged and ready to use!
ME5E.AbilityUseRechargeHint: This {type} is depleted and must be recharged!
ME5E.AbilityUseNormalHint: This {type} has {value} of {max} uses per {per} remaining.
ME5E.AbilityUseConsumableChargeHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 charge of {value} remaining.
ME5E.AbilityUseConsumableQuantityHint: Using this {type} will consume 1 quantity of {quantity} remaining
ME5E.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyHint: Using this {type} will consume its final charge and it will be destroyed.
ME5E.AbilityUseConsumableDestroyResource: Using this {type} will consume the final charge off {name} and destroy it.
ME5E.AbilityConfigure: Configure Ability Checks and Saving Throws
ME5E.AbilityConfigurationHint: Configure ability saving throw proficiency, saving throw bonuses, and check bonuses.
ME5E.AbilityCheckGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all ability checks made by this actor.
ME5E.ActionWarningNoItem: The requested item {item} no longer exists on Actor {name}
ME5E.ActionWarningNoToken: You must have one or more controlled Tokens in order to use this option.
ME5E.ActorWarningInvalidItem: {itemType} items cannot be added to a {actorType}.
ME5E.ActiveEffectOverrideWarning: This value is being modified by an Active Effect and cannot be edited. Disable the effect to edit it.
ME5E.AddEmbeddedItemPromptHint: Do you want to add these items to your character sheet?
ME5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementH: Allow the player to increase one or more ability scores or take an optional feat.
ME5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementF: Drop a feat here to choose one instead of an ability score improvement.
Only features with the 'feat' type can be selected.
ME5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementL: Scores cannot be modified with a feat selected.
ME5E.AdvancementAbilityScoreImprovementP: Number of points that can be assigned to any ability score below the maximum that doesn't have a fixed improvement set.
ME5E.AdvancementConfigureAllowDropsHint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
ME5E.AdvancementConfigureDropAreaHint: Drop Items here to add them to the pool from which a player can choose.
ME5E.AdvancementDeleteConfirmationMessag: Deleting this item will also delete all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
ME5E.AdvancementFlowDropAreaHint: Drop an Item here to choose it.
ME5E.AdvancementHitPointsHint: Track the player's hit points for each level in the class.
ME5E.AdvancementHitPointsEmptyError: Hit points must be rolled or the average value must be taken.
ME5E.AdvancementHitPointsInvalidError: Hit points must be a valid whole number.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceHint: Present the player with a choice of items (such as equipment, features, or spells) that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceLevelsHint: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoicePreviouslyChos: This item has already been chosen at a previous level.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelAvai: Only {level} or lower spells can be chosen for this advancement.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelSpec: Only {level} spells can be chosen for this advancement.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceSpellLevelHint: Only allow choices from spells of this level.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeHint: Restrict what Item types can be choosen.
ME5E.AdvancementItemChoiceTypeWarning: Only {type} items can be selected for this choice.
ME5E.AdvancementItemGrantHint: Grant the character items (such as equipment, features, or spells) when they reach a certain level.
ME5E.AdvancementItemGrantDropHint: Drop Items here to add them to the list granted by this advancement.
ME5E.AdvancementItemGrantDuplicateWarnin: That item already exists on this advancement.
ME5E.AdvancementItemGrantRecursiveWarnin: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
ME5E.AdvancementItemGrantOptionalHint: If optional, players will be given the option to opt out of any of the following items, otherwise all of them are granted.
ME5E.AdvancementItemTypeInvalidWarning: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
ME5E.AdvancementLevelDownConfirmationMes: Leveling this class down will also undo all advancement choices made for it. These changes will be removed from your character as long as the checkbox below is checked.
ME5E.AdvancementManagerCloseMessage: If the advancement process is cancelled, choices made so far will be discarded and no changes will be made to the actor.
ME5E.AdvancementManagerRestartConfirm: Are you sure you wish to undo all choices so far?
ME5E.AdvancementMigrationHint: Select which of the following advancements will be added to {name}.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueHint: A single value that changes as a class increases in level that is made available in roll formulas (such as a Monk's martial arts die).
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueIdentifierHint: This scale value for the current level will be available using @scale.{class}.{identifier} in a formula.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintCR: Use this for representing creature challenge ratings for features like Wild Shape.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDice: Use this for dice values like bardic inspiration, sneak attack, or superiority dice.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintDistan: Use this for numerical values that represent a distance, such as unarmored movement speed, or aura of protection radius.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintNumber: Use this for purely numerical values like rage damage bonus or number of uses per day.
ME5E.AdvancementScaleValueTypeHintString: Use this if you are unsure of the type of the scale values, or if the type does not matter.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitHint: Grant a character certain traits or give them an option to select traits (such as proficiencies, skills, languages).
ME5E.AdvancementTraitAllowReplacementsHi: If a trait is already set on the actor, allow the player to choose from any other trait as a replacement.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitChoiceModeExclusive: Player can make a choice from only one set of choices.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitChoiceModeInclusive: Player will be able to choose from all available sets of choices.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitChoicesHint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitGrantsHint: The following traits will be granted to the character as long as they don't already possess that trait.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitModeExpertiseHint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitModeForceHint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.
ME5E.AdvancementTraitModeUpgradeHint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.
ME5E.ArmorConfigHint: Fill in the above box to override automatically calculated armor class.
ME5E.BonusesHint: Define global bonuses as formulas which are added to certain rolls. For example: 1d4 + 2
ME5E.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll
ME5E.ClassIdentifierHint: This class's data will be accessible using @classes.{identifier} in roll formulas.
ME5E.ClassMakeOriginalHint: First class taken by character used to determine certain class traits when multiclassing.
ME5E.ConsumeWarningNoResource: {name} is designated to consume {type} but no resource is specified!
ME5E.ConsumeWarningNoSource: The designated {type} source that {name} consumes no longer exists!
ME5E.ConsumeWarningNoQuantity: {name} has run out of its designated {type}!
ME5E.ConsumeWarningZeroAttribute: {name} has run out of its designated attribute resource pool!
ME5E.ConsumableLastChargeWarn: This is the last charge of this unit and consuming it will also reduce the item's quantity by 1
ME5E.DamagePhysicalBypassHint: These weapon properties will bypass damage resistance for physical damage.
ME5E.DeathSaveCriticalSuccess: {name} critically succeeded on a death saving throw and has regained 1 Hit Point!
ME5E.DeathSaveSuccess: {name} has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!
ME5E.DeathSaveFailure: {name} has died with 3 death save failures!
ME5E.DeathSaveUnnecessary: You do not need to roll death saves because you have a positive number of hit points or have already reached 3 successes or failures.
ME5E.EffectUnavailableInfo: Source item must be equipped or attuned to activate these
ME5E.FilterNoSpells: No spells found for this set of filters.
ME5E.NoSpellLevels: This character has no spellcaster levels, but you may add spells manually.
ME5E.FlagsInstructions: Configure character features and traits which fine-tune behaviors of the ME5e system.
ME5E.FlagsDiamondSoulHint: Gain proficiency to all saving throws.
ME5E.FlagsElvenAccuracyHint: Roll an extra d20 with advantage to Dex, Int, Wis, or Cha.
ME5E.FlagsHalflingLuckyHint: Reroll ones when rolling d20 checks.
ME5E.FlagsInitiativeAdvHint: Provided by feats or magical items.
ME5E.FlagsJOATHint: Half-Proficiency to Ability Checks in which you are not already Proficient.
ME5E.FlagsObservantHint: Provides a +5 to passive Perception and Investigation.
ME5E.FlagsRemarkableAthleteHint: Half-Proficiency (rounded-up) to physical Ability Checks and Initiative.
ME5E.FlagsWeaponCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for weapon attacks.
ME5E.FlagsSpellCritThresholdHint: An expanded critical hit threshold for spell attacks.
ME5E.FlagsMeleeCriticalDiceHint: A number of additional damage dice added to melee weapon critical hits.
ME5E.FormulaMissingReferenceWarn: The {property} formula within {name} has references to missing data: {references}
ME5E.HPFormulaError: The provided hit point formula could not be evaluated.
ME5E.HitDiceConfigHint: Adjust remaining hit dice levels for each class.
ME5E.HitDiceWarn: {name} has no available {formula} Hit Dice remaining!
ME5E.IdentifierError: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).
ME5E.InitiativeConfigHint: Configure initiative modifiers and bonuses which apply to this Actor.
ME5E.ItemDestroyEmptyTooltip: If this item has limited uses, it will be destroyed when none are left.
ME5E.ItemRecoveryFormulaWarning: Unable to recover charges for {name}. Invalid recovery formula '{formula}'.
ME5E.LimitedUsesPromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt to consume an available use will be suppressed.
ME5E.LongRestHint: Take a long rest? On a long rest you will recover hit points, half your maximum hit dice, class resources, limited use item charges, and spell slots.
ME5E.LongRestResult: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points and {dice} Hit Dice.
ME5E.LongRestResultHitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {dice} Hit Dice.
ME5E.LongRestResultHitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {health} Hit Points.
ME5E.MaxCharacterLevelExceededWarn: Character cannot be advanced past level {max}.
ME5E.MaxClassLevelExceededWarn: Class cannot be advanced past level {max}.
ME5E.MaxClassLevelMinimumWarn: Class must have at least one level.
ME5E.ModuleArtConfigH: Configure which module-provided art should be used.
ME5E.Name: Character Name
ME5E.MovementConfigHint: Configure movement speed and special movement attributes.
ME5E.NewDayHint: Recover limited use abilities which recharge "per day"?
ME5E.SaveGlobalBonusHint: This bonus applies to all saving throws made by this actor.
ME5E.SensesConfigHint: Configure any special sensory perception abilities that this actor possesses.
ME5E.ShortRestHint: Take a short rest? On a short rest you may spend remaining Hit Dice and recover primary or secondary resources.
ME5E.ShortRestResult: {name} takes a short rest spending {dice} Hit Dice to recover {health} Hit Points.
ME5E.SkillGlobalBonusCheckHint: This bonus applies to all skill checks made by this actor.
ME5E.SpellCastNoSlots: You have no available {level} spell slots with which to cast {name}
ME5E.SpellCastNoSlotsLeft: You have no available spell slots with which to cast {name}!
ME5E.SubclassIdentifierHint: This identifier should match the identifier on the parent class to ensure they are properly linked.
ME5E.SubclassAssignmentError: {class} already has a subclass. Remove the existing '{subclass}' subclass before adding a new one.
ME5E.SubclassDuplicateError: A subclass with the identifier {identifier} already exists on this actor.
ME5E.SubclassMismatchWarn: {name} subclass has no matching class with identifier '{class}'.
ME5E.TemplatePromptTooltip: If unchecked, the prompt for placing a Measured Template will be suppressed.
ME5E.VehicleActionsHint: Actions taken with full crew complement
ME5E.WarnBadACFormula: The provided AC formula could not be evaluated.
ME5E.WarnCantAddMultipleAdvancements: It is not currently possible to add multiple items with advancements to an actor at the same time. Please add them individually.
ME5E.WarnMultipleArmor: More than one suit of armor equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
ME5E.WarnMultipleShields: More than one shield equipped, AC calculation may be incorrect.
ME5E.description: A system for playing the fifth edition of the worlds most popular roleplaying game in the Foundry Virtual Tabletop environment.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.AdditionalEq: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.AdditionalHi: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.AdditionalTr: List of proficiencies granted by this class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.DescriptionH: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.FeaturesDesc: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features, which are summarized in the {name} table.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.HitPointsLev: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.NoValidClass: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.OptionalFeat: The following section contains options {class} features. These features are not granted automatically, and you can choose one, some, or all of them at your DM's discretion.
JOURNALENTRYPAGE.ME5E.Class.SubclassDesc: Introduction that will be displayed before this class's subclasses.
MACRO.5eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.5eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MACRO.5eNoActorSelected: No selected or assigned actor could be found to target with macro.
MACRO.5eUnownedWarn: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items
MIGRATION.5eBegin: Applying ME5E System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.5eComplete: ME5E System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.5eVersionTooOldWarning: Your ME5e system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.
SETTINGS.5eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.5eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)
SETTINGS.5eCriticalMaxDiceL: Make critical hits more deadly by maximizing the values of base damage dice.
SETTINGS.5eCriticalModifiersL: Make critical hits more deadly by multiplying non-dice modifiers in addition to rolled dice.
SETTINGS.5eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 143.
SETTINGS.5eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.5eFeatsL: Allow players to choose a feat rather than taking an ability score improvement during class advancement.
SETTINGS.5eInitTBL: Append the raw Dexterity ability score to break ties in Initiative.
SETTINGS.5eMetricL: Replaces all reference to lbs with kgs and updates the encumbrance calculations to use metric weight units.
SETTINGS.5eNoAdvancementsL: Do not prompt for level-up or character creation choices.
SETTINGS.5eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.5eProfL: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll. Reloading the world is required for this change to take effect.
SETTINGS.5eRestL: Configure which rest variant should be used for games within this system.
